subject: Re: [junit] Testability
msgSnippet: ... I am *really* looking forward to seeing some the examples you are working. Something really simple that illustrates the point you re making here would go a
messageBody:
Scott Stirling wrote:

> ...It's amazing how much a very clean, tight TDD design, at the end,
> can look so different from what one would have developed if going with
> the top-down, modeling objects approach.

I am *really* looking forward to seeing some the examples you are
working.
Something really simple that illustrates the point you're making here
would
go a long way towards helping me revise my design philosophy.

Along those lines...

I've obtained a number of good books, recently. I recall that one of
them
was supposed to be excellent because it "took you to the next step
beyond
noun and verb analysis to identify an object/inheritance hierarchy".
Does that
ring a bell with anyone? (I want to read that one next!)


> I wonder if "changeability" (and "sharability" could be reduced and
> made more precise by analysis, like I am trying to reduce
> "testability" and "maintainability." I think most of these "-ability"
> words are shorthand for more fundamental principles that, if made
> explicit, would help raise software engineering to a more
> sophisticated art form if not a science.

Hell of a thesis, that.
